Functions

void eol_particle_init ()
 initializes the particle system based on the loaded configuration.
eolBool eol_particle_initialized ()
 retrieves the initialization status of the particle system
void eol_particle_config ()
 loads the global particle configuration. such as max number of particles.
void eol_particle_clear ()
 resets all particles to a zero state. Useful to stop any particles between levels.
void eol_particle_draw_all ()
 draws all living particles.
void eol_particle_update_all ()
 updates the orientations / ticks down the life of all particles.
eolParticle * eol_particle_new ()
 get a pointer to a new particle You do not own the memory location returned. Do not hold onto it. Set it and forget it.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum eolParticleTypes

the particle system provides short lived, dumb, temporary entities. particles do not think, they do not interact with physics. They exist purely to provide special effects such as bullet trails, explosions, water sprays, etc.

Enumerator:
eolParticlePoint 
eolParticleTrail 
eolParticleSprite 
eolParticleModel

Definition at line 204 of file eol_particle.c.

eolParticle* eol_particle_new (  ) 

get a pointer to a new particle You do not own the memory location returned. Do not hold onto it. Set it and forget it.

Returns:
a pointer a newly assigned particle or NULL when no more room.
